metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2124 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s XFSfile system in how a user restores an XFS image after failure (with a dirtylog journal). This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentiallyescalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic-64k - 5.15.0-79.86
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1039-kvm - 5.15.0-1039.44
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-79.86').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1039.44').
